No cryptocurrency ecosystem has a developer community more active than Ethereum’s. There’s a lot to say about who should be considered “Ethereum developer”. Is a dev @ bitmex a “bitcoin developer” because bitmex uses BTC? I don’t know. But they do have a larger dev community
Lots of great research is funded by Ethereum Foundation. Things like ZK-STARKs and other types of privacy tech. Research is good, and the problems are real

I have much criticism on how the Ethereum community has been reorganizing itself over the last 2 years, but look at big picture since day 0 to today, ETH did a great job at community building. It’s a passionate bunch and god knows they’re passionate even when price chart is harsh

1/ It's been a pretty insane last couple of days for #Ethereum and DeFi.  In the midst of the chaos, @tokensets users have been very happy as most of the Sets were sitting in USD when the market drop happened.  Let's review!   https://t.co/5WGAYwo1ZW  (thread)  https://t.co/xhXXsqeIZM

While many of the so-called “dapps” built on top of ethereum are completely centralized, they do a good job at rallying enthusiasm around fixing single points of failure. I don’t know if they’ll succeed but it’s great that someone’s trying
